sentences.sContent: You shouldn’t believe everything you read.
sentences.sCn: 你不应尽信书上看来的东西。

sentences.sContent: I believed him, even though his story sounded unlikely.
sentences.sCn: 我相信了他，尽管他的话听上去难以置信。

sentences.sContent: I don’t believe a word of it (=  I think it is completely untrue  ) .
Did you honestly believe that I’d be stupid enough to do that?
sentences.sCn: 你真的认为我会傻到做那样的事情吗？。

sentences.sContent: ...Don’t you remember all those things we used to believe when we were little...
...Certain professors believe in-class exams are ultimately more helpful to students...
...Some believe take-home exams may affect students' performance in other courses...
...The most difficult step in programming values will be deciding exactly what we believe in moral...
...People in our neighborhood find it hard to believe she's my twin sister...
...because legislators believe it attracts children to unhealthy food...
...Administrators seem to believe that only hard work will lead children to their educational goals...
...I firmly believe that listening is of greater significance than talking...
...Some experts believe that human intelligence develops by the use of hands...

phrases.pCn: [口语][用以加强语气]相信我的话，相信我说的是真的(或算数的)；真的

trans.tranOther: to be sure that something is true or that someone is telling the truth
